Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric contains many small white and metallic inclusions, the interior is partially covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393843) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393843)
